title: 110_s1999
content: CENTER OF EXCELLENCE IN PREVENTION, DIAGNOSIS, MITIGATION, TREATMENT, AND REHABILITATION OF MILITARY EYE INJURIES. The Secretary of Defense shall establish a Center of Excellence in Prevention, Diagnosis, Mitigation, Treatment, and Rehabilitation of Military Eye Injuries within the Department of Defense. The center will collaborate with the Department of Veterans Affairs and institutions of higher education. The Center of Excellence in Prevention, Diagnosis, Mitigation, Treatment, and Rehabilitation of Military Eye Injuries within the Department of Defense collaborates with Veterans Affairs and other entities to develop and oversee the Military Eye Injury Registry for tracking and exchanging information on eye injuries incurred by armed forces members in combat. The Center of Excellence in Prevention, Diagnosis, Mitigation, Treatment, and Rehabilitation of Military Eye Injuries collaborates with the Department of Defense specialists to develop the Military Eye Injury Registry. The Registry tracks and collects information on eye injuries, ensuring timely submission of diagnosis, surgical interventions, treatments, and follow-up procedures from medical facilities. The Center coordinates visual rehabilitation benefits for armed forces members with combat-related eye injuries and visual acuity of \20/200\ or less in either eye. The Military Eye Injury Registry provides information on combat-related eye injuries to aid in research and clinical education for veterans with eye injuries. The Secretary of Defense will include records of OIF/OEF veterans with eye injuries in the Military Eye Injury Registry. A report on the status of the Center of Excellence in Prevention, Diagnosis, Mitigation, Treatment, and Rehabilitation of military eye injuries will be submitted to Congress within 180 days. The Secretary of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs will conduct a cooperative study on neuro-optometric screening and diagnosis for members of the Armed Forces with Traumatic Brain Injury. This includes vision screening, diagnosis, rehabilitative management, and vision research at selected military medical treatment facilities and medical centers. Authorization of Appropriations for the Department of Defense in fiscal year 2008 for the Center of Excellence in Prevention, Diagnosis, Mitigation, Treatment, and Rehabilitation of Military Eye Injuries is $5,000,000 under section 1105a of title 10, United States Code.
